label: q_it05_q03_longitudinal
content:
{
  "question_id": "it05_q03_longitudinal",
  "scope_id": "insider_threat_05",
  "checkpoint_after": 25,
  "question_type": "longitudinal",
  "prompt": "What is the nature of the security threat indicated by the access logs and DLP alerts?",
  "ground_truth": {
    "canonical_answer": "Systematic IP exfiltration by jmorris, a departing employee. The pattern shows widening file access scope, escalating download volumes, and encrypted uploads to personal cloud storage. The red team exercise was a red herring that masked the real exfiltration activity in alert noise.",
    "required_evidence_refs": [
      "insider_threat_05_ep_010",
      "insider_threat_05_ep_017",
      "insider_threat_05_ep_024",
      "insider_threat_05_ep_015"
    ],
    "key_facts": [
      "lateral information gathering pattern inconsistent with declared operational role",
      "data transfer volumes from a single account diverge from peer group norms in a sustained multi-week pattern",
      "departing employee access anomalies warrant immediate credential revocation and forensic evidence preservation",
      "red team exercise alerts are not related to the exfiltration activity"
    ]
  }
}
